mn140:19.5.pli: So sukhaṁ vedanaṁ vedayamāno ‘sukhaṁ vedanaṁ vedayāmī’ti pajānāti.
mn140:19.5.en: When they feel a pleasant feeling, they know: ‘I feel a pleasant feeling.’

mn140:19.14.pli: evameva kho, bhikkhu, sukhavedaniyaṁ phassaṁ paṭicca uppajjati sukhā vedanā.
mn140:19.14.en: In the same way, pleasant feeling arises dependent on a contact to be experienced as pleasant. …

mn140:23.1.pli: So sukhañce vedanaṁ vedeti, ‘sā aniccā’ti pajānāti, ‘anajjhositā’ti pajānāti, ‘anabhinanditā’ti pajānāti.
mn140:23.1.en: If they feel a pleasant feeling, they understand that it’s impermanent, that they’re not attached to it, and that they don’t take pleasure in it.

mn140:24.1.pli: So sukhañce vedanaṁ vedeti, visaṁyutto naṁ vedeti;
mn140:24.1.en: If they feel a pleasant feeling, they feel it detached.

mlDocs.title:
Middle Discourses 140
The Analysis of the Elements

dn22:11.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu sukhaṁ vā vedanaṁ vedayamāno ‘sukhaṁ vedanaṁ vedayāmī’ti pajānāti.
dn22:11.2.en: It’s when a mendicant who feels a pleasant feeling knows: ‘I feel a pleasant feeling.’

dn22:11.5.pli: Sāmisaṁ vā sukhaṁ vedanaṁ vedayamāno ‘sāmisaṁ sukhaṁ vedanaṁ vedayāmī’ti pajānāti.
dn22:11.5.en: When they feel a material pleasant feeling, they know: ‘I feel a material pleasant feeling.’

dn22:11.6.pli: Nirāmisaṁ vā sukhaṁ vedanaṁ vedayamāno ‘nirāmisaṁ sukhaṁ vedanaṁ vedayāmī’ti pajānāti.
dn22:11.6.en: When they feel a spiritual pleasant feeling, they know: ‘I feel a spiritual pleasant feeling.’

dn22:19.36.pli: manosamphassajā vedanā loke piyarūpaṁ sātarūpaṁ, etthesā taṇhā uppajjamānā uppajjati, ettha nivisamānā nivisati.
dn22:19.36.en: feeling born of mind contact in the world seems nice and pleasant, and it is there that craving arises and settles.

mlDocs.title:
Long Discourses 22
The Longer Discourse on Mindfulness Meditation

mn10:32.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu sukhaṁ vā vedanaṁ vedayamāno ‘sukhaṁ vedanaṁ vedayāmī’ti pajānāti.
mn10:32.2.en: It’s when a mendicant who feels a pleasant feeling knows: ‘I feel a pleasant feeling.’

mn10:32.5.pli: Sāmisaṁ vā sukhaṁ vedanaṁ vedayamāno ‘sāmisaṁ sukhaṁ vedanaṁ vedayāmī’ti pajānāti.
mn10:32.5.en: When they feel a material pleasant feeling, they know: ‘I feel a material pleasant feeling.’

mn10:32.6.pli: Nirāmisaṁ vā sukhaṁ vedanaṁ vedayamāno ‘nirāmisaṁ sukhaṁ vedanaṁ vedayāmī’ti pajānāti.
mn10:32.6.en: When they feel a spiritual pleasant feeling, they know: ‘I feel a spiritual pleasant feeling.’
